item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: bobbo
item.description:
Brombaq:

I love the level up announcer

I agree… that’s what does it for me. Titles he gives are genius.

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Someonerandm:

That wasn’t really accurate though. In an actual modern game you would have never been able to open that door at the end.

And there was no scrappy annoying iron sights mechanic!

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
In Gears 2, even though it had modes where you could respawn, I still didn’t like the way MP felt.

I loved Horde mode, though, and I think it’s cool how they’re taking it a step further and L4D Versus Survival’ing it. I just didn’t like the way either game was balanced for MP, and thought it was fun and well balanced in coop.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
BahamutBBob:

I don’t mind multiplayer taking skill, but I don’t like how Gears uses the Counter Strike approach to matches. It’s a lot easier for me to learn what works and what doesn’t when I don’t have to wait a long time to respawn, usually forgetting the finer points of what exactly I did wrong and the other guy did right.

I know what you mean, thats why I’m glad Gears 2 had a vs bot mode so I could practice.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
MDIGN:

Gears was awesome, gameplay was awesome, story was awesome, it also made sense.
The multiplayer required skill unlike most multiplayer games nowadays cough COD :MW-BO cough

I don’t mind multiplayer taking skill, but I don’t like how Gears uses the Counter Strike approach to matches. It’s a lot easier for me to learn what works and what doesn’t when I don’t have to wait a long time to respawn, usually forgetting the finer points of what exactly I did wrong and the other guy did right.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
Maxey:

Am I the only one who can’t stand that “Oh lol, x y or z is better than Call of Duty lmao” trend? Everytime I watch some video on youtube about some FPS game, the comments are flooded with “oh lol this game is better than cod lmao”.

Christ, WE GET IT! You think CoD is overrated. Who cares?

It’s not that for me, it’s the people that play em’, (and the storyline ;P).
It’s like a 1/over 9 thousandd!!!1!1!1one!111!!eleven!1111onethousandeleven!1!
chance to find a match with out people that aren’t either racist, duche bags, or a little kid that likes to talk alot of shiz.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
if I was forced into real world combat I would probably camp, prefire at every corner, hide behind teammates, throw as many flashbangs as I can get my hands on and scream HAX right before I die.

Also I would spray tags everywhere.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Yes, but I don’t play video games to experience real life combat. Real life combat involves praying day after day that a bullet doesn’t kill or mutilate you, and that you will live to see your family again. Video games involve fun. Chest high walls do not provide an optimum fun dispensing experience.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
In real life combat situations you’ll be praying for some chest-high walls to hide behind when the lead starts flying around.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
Meh, I just have a personal preference against hiding behind chest-high walls constantly save a few moments when you shoot someone.

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
But the true question is whether or not the mechanics of war have changed over time. As a counterpoint to Fallout guy, I need merely to point to snake, whose thesis “War has changed” has wide ranging implications, and has giant jumping tanks to back this up.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Well technically, the base concept still applies- the ostensibly somewhat Hobbesian viewpoint of the Fallout narrator indicates that humankind will always, inexorably come into conflict with one another. It’s more or less part of the condition.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: Harun
item.description:
Someonerandm:

What were we talking about?

we were actually talking about if or if not war was, is or will be changing, which leads to the question what war actually is. because if war indeed does change that would mean that the change war is bringing affects war and thus changes war which would answer the question if or if not war was, is or will be changing. But even if war changes does that mean that it changes things? is a war that isn´t changing anything basicly futile? if you see it that way, war clearly does change and thus the guy with the awesome voice in the fallout intro and outro is wrong.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
About how Gears of War 1 wasn’t half bad?

I rather liked it. Gears 2 grated on the nerve endings for it’s terrible writing of Dom’s subplot with the wife. It doesn’t take up too much of the game, but the difficulty spikes around the assault on Jericho Plateau, so I haven’t finished it yet.

Mirror’s Edge was pretty close to the same length, and I liked that one too, despite the between mission “E-Surance” ad-esque cutscenes undermining the game’s story and occasional problems with movement. Of course, I got it for $20 anticipating the short length.

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: Someonerandm
item.description:
And it was incredibly tedious and the environments were fairly bland and it introduced one of the worst systems of gameplay I’ve seen in a game. Still had its moments though.

What were we talking about?

Read full topic

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: BahamutBBob
item.description:
Gears of War 1’s multiplayer was an afterthought, and it’s campaign was only ~6 hours.

item.title: Just beat Modern Warfare 3
item.dc:creator: garrthbarrttinn
item.description:
SoaringScout:

$10 says the Bulletstorm singleplayer campaign will be only an hour or two longer than an average Call of Duty singleplayer campaign.

I’ll happily take you up on that. Actually, lets make it 50. I really doubt a game that focuses on singleplayer is going to be about the same as a game that focuses on multiplayer. Especially seeing as the other game is notoriously short.

Read full topic
